body.name: Roku 65" Plus Series 4K Dolby Vision HDR10+ QLED Smart RokuTV with Voice Remote Pro, Striking 4K Resolution, Automatic Brightness, Dolby Vision and HDR10+
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs 44 mins
features: Made by Roku: From the brand you trust to make streaming easier comes a new, thoughtfully designed smart TV powered by the delightfully simple Roku experience.

Breathtaking 4K picture & auto brightness: Stunningly sharp 4K resolution brings out the rich detail in your entertainment with four times the resolution of HD, and avoid fiddling with settings with a screen that automatically adjusts based on your room’s lighting.
Colorful QLED screen: Watch strikingly accurate hues pop off the QLED screen with an expanded color palette and increased brightness.

See it to believe it: Experience eye-popping detail in spectacular color, contrast, and brightness with Dolby Vision and HDR10+, plus sharp contrast with local dimming for vivid highlights and deep darks.
Our best streaming experience: Enjoy a massive selection of free, live, and premium TV with streaming apps that launch in a snap and our best Wi-Fi for fast, seamless streaming.
body.description: Roku Plus Series TVs are thoughtfully designed for a premium entertainment experience at an incredible value. Turn any living room into a cinematic landscape with a breathtaking QLED screen and watch in awe as strikingly accurate colors pop off your screen with Dolby Vision and HDR10+. Launch your streaming favorites lightning quick and enjoy brilliant 4K picture that’s optimized for your room lighting with automatic brightness. Catch every word with built-in sound features like auto speech clarity and night mode or crank up the volume anytime with Headphone Mode. The rechargeable, hands-free voice remote makes it easy to find entertainment—or even itself under your deepest couch cushions. There’s never been a more delightful way to enjoy what you love. A smart TV made by Roku? Now that makes sense.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set-up and use, and exactly what I wanted!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a 75" Roku TV after purchasing an 80" more expensive brand for another room - that cost more than twice as much. I use the Roku instead of the bigger, fancier brand. Roku's picture quality, brightness, sound, and everything works well and is all I need. Where I REALLY appreciate the Roku is the ease of use. Many of the newer TVs have "magic" remotes which are like Wii controllers, are complicated to use, flash ads, require software updates, passwords, and all sorts of processes to just watch a simple TV show. It's so tedious and such a hassle, I don't like turning it on. The Roku has all the apps and technology I need, but is simple to set-up and use. I get to WATCH TV, not enter passwords, dodge ads, and navigate the TV like a game system. I am a loyal Roku fan at this point!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Roku TV because
reviews.reviewText: I replaced a Sharp Roku TV with the Roku Brand TV to get a larger size. I had a Roku wireless sound bar and did not want to have to replace it because I changed formats. So are there better TV's for the money, perhaps but for our purposes the picture is quite good (really 4 1/2 stars). I got the TV on sale and there again you might find a TV less expensive, but this fulfilled our needs (also 4 1/2 stars)I think the main selling feature is the way Roku and the remote works. It is easy to find what you are looking for once you get use to how it works.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The box and TV inside Arrived completely destroyed. Screen coming off, corners dented, picture didn’t work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It seems to work well. Decent clarity. Was hoping it had that 3-D type look, maybe I am just not watching the right shows...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy setup, great picture quality
reviews.reviewText: I replaced my 55" ULED TV with this QLED TV and what a difference in picture quality. The colors are more vibrant and there is less motion blur than the ULED TV. Setup was easy and quick, just had to charge the remote for a few minutes, but the results were worth it. Great TV at a decent price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Sports fans, don’t buy!
reviews.reviewText: Picture quality almost has haze or cloud appearnce to it. The TV motion cannot keep up with moving players during a game. I have other TVs in my house and they don’t have those issues. The audible alarm to find the remote is a plus. Not sure how I feel about another device to able to listen to me just to use the “hey Roku” feature, you can toggle it off. It’s nice to connect all your devices to the tv and control through Roku. I am huge Roku fan, but they missed the bar on this. I even waited for the price to drop from $500 to $400. I would not waste your time. I will be returning mine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Way better than my old TV that died after 15 years

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Operates fast, bright colors and options to darken or auto adjust picture . You can see a slight cloudy picture if you’re not facing directly at the tv, not a deal breaker, but was the first thing I noticed. I haven’t gamed with it but football was no issue for me.
